edu.vserver.exercises.model
Interface ExecutionSettings

All Known Implementing Classes:
StubExecutionSettings, TestingExecutionSettings
public interface ExecutionSettings

Implementor of this interface tells what kind of feedback can be shown to the user during certain execution of an exercise. Also tells the executor whether it should be in "exam"-mode, which is a mode that most exercises do not have to react to.

However, if user feedback is shown only in the Feedback-component returned in the SubmissionFeedback these settings can mostly be ignored as that Feedback-component will be hidden by the system if it should not be shown.

Author:
Riku Haavisto, Johannes Holvitie

Method Summary
 boolean isExam()
          Some exercises might have settings that should be changed if the executor is run under exam-settings that do not strictly fall into any exact and general categories.
 boolean isNoCorrAnswers()
          When this is true, the correct answers should not be shown to the user during execution.
 boolean isNoTips()
          In certain situations (eg. possibly in exams) no feed-back on the correctness of the users answers should be shown to the user during the execution of an exercise.
 

Method Detail

isNoTips

boolean isNoTips()
In certain situations (eg. possibly in exams) no feed-back on the correctness of the users answers should be shown to the user during the execution of an exercise. Then this method will return true.

Returns:
whether any feed-back should not be shown to the user through the executor

isNoCorrAnswers

boolean isNoCorrAnswers()
When this is true, the correct answers should not be shown to the user during execution. General-tips are however allowed, if the isNoTips() returns false.

Returns:
whether correct answers should not be shown as such in the user-interface

isExam

boolean isExam()
Some exercises might have settings that should be changed if the executor is run under exam-settings that do not strictly fall into any exact and general categories. Most exercise-types can however ignore this value.

Returns:
whether the executor is run under exam-mode
